meanings.definition: A sudden, loud noise or explosion
meanings.sent1: The whoomphs of fireworks filled the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The whoomphs of thunder echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The whoomphs of the balloons popping made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The whoomphs of excitement in the crowd were palpable.
meanings.sent5: The whoomphs of the cannon firing signaled the start of the race.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden, loud noise or explosion
meanings.sent1: He whoomphs the balloon to scare his sister.
meanings.sent2: The firework whoomphs startled the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent3: She whoomphs the door closed behind her, causing a stir.
meanings.sent4: The car whoomphs down the road, leaving a trail of dust.
meanings.sent5: The magician whoomphs the smoke to create a mysterious effect.

meanings.definition: The sound of something heavy falling or hitting the ground with force
meanings.sent1: The whoomphs of the books falling off the shelf startled her.
meanings.sent2: The whoomphs of the hammer hitting the nail echoed in the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The whoomphs of the watermelon hitting the ground made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The whoomphs of the tree branch falling were heard throughout the forest.
meanings.sent5: The whoomphs of the boulder rolling down the hill were deafening.
